document_data.name: Bruc and Pishe's Emporium
document_data.mainbody: '''Bruc and Pishe's Emporium''', previously known as '''Tina Turki's Good Time Bazaar''', was a business located in the [[Baldur's Gate/Lower City|Lower City]] of [[Baldur's Gate]], within the infamous [[Guild]]'s territory in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Location: Bruc and Pishe's was a small two-story building with its entrance facing the hidden entrance down into the Guild's Guildhall bar and hideout. By the late 15{{th}} century DR, the business' sign was old, broken, and rusted with "Bruc and Pishe's Emporium" written on it as well as its previous name, "Tina Turki's Good Time Bazaar."
document_data.History: At some point before the [[Absolute crisis]] of the {{YearlinkName|1492}}, Bruc and Pishe's Emporium was abandoned and claimed by the Guild. During that time, the shop was used to store shipments of the Guild, as well as books, letters, and reports, including the Guild's communications with certain members of the [[patriar]] families of Baldur's Gate as well as with the [[Counting House]].
